panels.description: The number of HTTP 4XX client error codes that originate from the load balancer. Client errors are generated when requests are malformed or incomplete. These requests were not received by the target, other than in the case where the load balancer returns an HTTP 460 error code. This count does not include any response codes generated by the targets.
panels.title: ELB HTTP 4XX Client error codes

panels.description: The number of HTTP 5XX server error codes that originate from the load balancer. This count does not include any response codes generated by the targets.
panels.title: ELB HTTP 5XX Server error codes

panels.description: The number of 200 HTTP response codes generated by the targets. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.
panels.title: Target HTTP 200 Responses  (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of 300 HTTP response codes generated by the targets. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.
panels.title: Target HTTP 300 Redirections (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of 400 HTTP response codes generated by the targets. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.
panels.title: Target HTTP 400 Client Errors (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of 500 HTTP response codes generated by the targets. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.
panels.title: Target HTTP 500 Server Errors (By Load Balancer)

panels.content:
Connections


&


Latencies

panels.description: The total number of concurrent TCP connections active from clients to the load balancer and from the load balancer to targets.
panels.title: Active Connections Count (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The total number of new TCP connections established from clients to the load balancer and from the load balancer to targets.
panels.title: New Connections Count (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of requests processed over IPv4 and IPv6. This count includes only the requests with a response generated by a target of the load balancer.
panels.title: Requests Count (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The time elapsed, in seconds, after the request leaves the load balancer until a response from the target is received.
panels.title: Target Response Time (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The time elapsed, in seconds, after the request leaves the load balancer until a response from the target is received.
panels.title: Target Response Time (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The time elapsed, in seconds, after the request leaves the load balancer until a response from the target is received.
panels.title: Target Response Time (By Target Group)

panels.description: The total number of concurrent TCP connections active from clients to the load balancer and from the load balancer to targets.
panels.title: Active Connections Count (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The total number of new TCP connections established from clients to the load balancer and from the load balancer to targets.
panels.title: New Connections Count (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of connections that were rejected because the load balancer had reached its maximum number of connections.
panels.title: Rejected Connections Count (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of connections that were not successfully established between the load balancer and target. This metric does not apply if the target is a Lambda function.
panels.title: Target Connections Error Count (By target group)

panels.description: The number of requests processed over IPv4 and IPv6. This count includes only the requests with a response generated by a target of the load balancer.
panels.title: Requests Count (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of IPv6 requests received by the load balancer.
panels.title: IPv6 Requests Count (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The average number of requests received by each target in a target group. This metric does not apply if the target is a Lambda function.
panels.title: Request Count (By Target Group)

panels.description: The number of requests where the load balancer chose a new target because it couldn't use an existing sticky session. For example, the request was the first request from a new client and no stickiness cookie was presented, a stickiness cookie was presented but it did not specify a target that was registered with this target group, the stickiness cookie was malformed or expired, or an internal error prevented the load balancer from reading the stickiness cookie.
panels.title: Non Sticky Requests Count  (By Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of 200 HTTP response codes generated by the targets. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.
panels.title: Target HTTP 200 Responses (By Target Group)

panels.description: The number of 300 HTTP response codes generated by the targets. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.
panels.title: Target HTTP 300 Redirections (By Target Group)

panels.description: The number of 400 HTTP response codes generated by the targets. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.
panels.title: Target HTTP 400 Client Errors (By Target Group)

panels.description: The number of 500 HTTP response codes generated by the targets. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.
panels.title: Target HTTP 500 Server Errors (By Target Group)

panels.description: The number of HTTP 3XX redirection codes that originate from the load balancer.
panels.title: ELB HTTP 3XX Redirections

panels.description: The number of HTTP 4XX client error codes that originate from the load balancer. Client errors are generated when requests are malformed or incomplete. These requests were not received by the target, other than in the case where the load balancer returns an HTTP 460 error code. This count does not include any response codes generated by the targets.
panels.title: ELB HTTP 4XX Client error codes

panels.description: The number of HTTP 5XX server error codes that originate from the load balancer. This count does not include any response codes generated by the targets.
panels.title: ELB HTTP 5XX Server error codes

panels.description: The number of fixed-response actions that were successful.
panels.title: HTTP Fixed Response Count

panels.description: The number of redirect actions that were successful.
panels.title: HTTP Redirect Count

panels.description: The number of redirect actions that couldn't be completed because the URL in the response location header is larger than 8K
panels.title: HTTP Redirect Url Limit Exceeded
Processed Bytes And Capacity Units (Per Load Balancer)

panels.description: The total number of bytes processed by the load balancer over IPv4 and IPv6. This count includes traffic to and from clients and Lambda functions, and traffic from an Identity Provider (IdP) if user authentication is enabled.
panels.title: Processed Bytes

panels.description: The total number of bytes processed by the load balancer over IPv6. This count is included in ProcessedBytes.
panels.title: IPv6 Processed Bytes

panels.description: The number of load balancer capacity units (LCU) used by your load balancer. You pay for the number of LCUs that you use per hour.
panels.title: Consumed Load Balancer Capacity Units

panels.description: The number of TLS connections initiated by the client that did not establish a session with the load balancer. Possible causes include a mismatch of ciphers or protocols.
panels.title: Client TLS Negotiation Error Count (Per Load Balancer)

panels.description: The number of TLS connections initiated by the load balancer that did not establish a session with the target. Possible causes include a mismatch of ciphers or protocols. This metric does not apply if the target is a Lambda function.
panels.title: Target TLS Negotiation Error Count (Per Target Group)

panels.description: The number of rules processed by the load balancer given a request rate averaged over an hour.
panels.title: Rule Evaluations
